Highlights Sunset Camel Ride in the Sahara (Merzouga) Ride into the golden dunes of the Sahara on camelback and watch the sun set over the desert — a bucket-list moment that blends adventure and tranquility. Winding Through the Fès Medina Explore one of the world’s oldest and most fascinating medinas with a local guide. From the ancient tanneries to the intricate artisan stalls, this maze-like city is a cultural deep dive into Moroccan heritage. Overnight Stay in a Mountain Gîte (High Atlas Mountains) Hike into the heart of the High Atlas Mountains and spend the night in a traditional Berber village. Enjoy a home-cooked meal and wake up to breathtaking views of Mt. Toubkal. The Blue City of Chefchaouen Wander the serene, blue-washed streets of Chefchaouen nestled in the Rif Mountains. With its relaxed vibe and stunning panoramas, this town is a photographer’s dream and a peaceful escape from the busier cities. Your Welcome Moment Welcome Moment - Meet Your CEO and Group Day 2 - Casablanca/Chefchaouen Stop in Tangier for a guided tour of the medina before continuing on to Chefchaouen for the evening.(B) Day 3 -Chefchaouen Enjoy a free day in Chefchaouen to explore. The city, whitewashed in different shades of blue, is spectacular on its own but with the surrounding mountains, it's a sight to behold. At sunset, opt to visit the Spanish Mosque for a stunning panoramic view of the city. (B) Day 4 -Chefchaouen/Fès Enjoy a G Adventures-supported traditional lunch before taking a guided tour of the ancient Roman ruins of Volubilis. Continue on to Fès.(B,L) Your G for Good Moment AFER Association Community Lunch Day 5 -Fès Explore the labyrinth of streets within the famous Fès medina with a local guide. Take in a view of one of the ancient tanneries from above and marvel at the myriad of colour and processes. (B) Day 6 -Fès/Merzouga (Enjoy a long, but beautiful, travel day across the unique landscapes of Morocco to get to the sand (B) Day 7 -Merzouga Explore the sand dunes by foot or opt to take a 4x4 excursion around the dunes. In the late afternoon, enjoy a camel ride to watch the sunset before returning to your hotel for an evening of entertainment. (B,D) Day 8 - Merzouga/Todra Gorge Rise early to watch the sunrise. After breakfast, continue through a stone desert to the stunning Todra Gorge. Wedged between massive cliff walls, the gorge is filled with a green oasis of palm trees. This serene spot is great for hiking, relaxing on the edge of the river or sampling some local Amazigh delicacies. (B) Day 9 - Todra Gorge/Aït Ben Haddou Visit the Aït Ben Haddou Kasbah, a UNESCO World Heritage site. Opt to participate in a tagine cooking class for an intro to Moroccan cuisine.(B) Day 10 -Ait Benhaddou / High Atlas Mountains Enjoy a hike to the village of Aroumd (Aremd), at the base of the High Atlas Mountains. Soak in views of Mt Toubkal from the mountain gîte hideaway before a home-cooked dinner.(B,D) Your Local Living Moment Mountain Gîte Stay with Traditional Moroccan Meal Day 11 - High Atlas Mountains / Essaouira Hike back to Imlil and transfer to the coastal town of Essaouira. Along the way stop by the G Adventure—supported Zarbiat Achbarou Cooperative Project for a carpet weaving demonstration and some tea before continuing on. The remainder of the day in Essaouira is free for exploration. (B) Your G for Good Moment Zarbiat Achbarou Cooperative Visit with Tea Day 12 -Essaouira Enjoy a free day exploring this coastal port town any way you like. (B) Day 13 - Essaouira/Marrakech Drive to Marrakech for a medina tour with a local guide. Opt to visit Djemaa el Fna Square in the evening to see the gathering of musicians and street performers.(B) Day 14 - Marrakech Enjoy a final free day to explore.(B) Your Discover Moment Day 15 - Marrakech Depart at any time.
